<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Cash generated
	from continuing operations in fiscal year 2016 was $231.6&nbsp;million, compared to $203.3&nbsp;million in the prior year. The
	increase in cash provided by operating activities-continuing operations was partially driven by an increase of $8.0 million in
	net income from continuing operations before non-cash asset impairment charges in fiscal year 2016, compared to the prior year.
	The decrease in non-cash items besides the asset impairment charges in fiscal year 2016 as compared to the prior year was primarily
	the result of a decrease in deferred income tax expense. In addition, depreciation expense was lower in fiscal year 2016 due to
	the cumulative effect of lower levels of capital investment activity in previous years along with the cumulative effect of restructuring
	asset write-offs over the past several years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Changes
	from June 30, 2015, in Assets and Liabilities, Net of Effects from Acquisition and Divestiture of Businesses consisted of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 11PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.15IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increase in cash flows in fiscal year 2016 due to changes in net prepaid expenses, accounts
	payable and accrued expenses was $44.1 million more than the year-ago period driven by overall cost reductions and the timing of
	the period-end relative to DeVry Group&rsquo;s payroll and bill payment cycles.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.45IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.15IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increase in cash flows in fiscal year 2016 due to changes in combined restricted cash, accounts
	receivable (excluding the provisions for refunds and uncollectible accounts) and deferred revenue was $29.0 million more than the
	year-ago period. The main driver of this change was a decrease in restricted cash and an increase in deferred revenue.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Cash Used in
	Investing Activities
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Capital
	expenditures in fiscal year 2016 were $69.4&nbsp;million compared to $88.7&nbsp;million in the prior year. DeVry Group continues
	to invest capital for the new Chamberlain and DeVry Brasil campuses and improving and expanding existing facilities within DMI,
	along with spending on facility consolidations at DeVry University.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Capital
	spending for fiscal year 2017 will support continued investment at RUSM and RUSVM; and facility improvements for Chamberlain and
	DeVry Brasil. Management anticipates full year fiscal year 2017 capital spending to be in the $80 million range.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	During
	the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016, DeVry Group sold the DeVry University Kansas City, Missouri campus. Net proceeds from this
	sale were $5.8 million which resulted in a $3.2 gain on the sale.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	During
	the third quarter of fiscal year 2016, DeVry Group sold the DeVry University Fremont, California campus and student housing facilities.
	Net proceeds from this sale were $24.8 million which resulted in a $3.8 gain on the sale. DeVry University currently leases a small
	portion of the campus facility where it may continue to operate until June 2017. The student housing facility was leased by DeVry
	University until June 30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	On June
	1, 2016, DeVry Brasil completed the acquisition of Facimp. Facimp is headquartered in Imperatriz, Maranhao. Facimp currently serves
	nearly 2,000 undergraduate students in 11 programs including business, law, nursing, pharmacy and dentistry. This acquisition continues
	the process of expanding DeVry Group&rsquo;s presence in Brazil. Under the terms of the agreement, DeVry Brasil agreed to pay approximately
	$6.3 million in cash, in exchange for the stock of Facimp. Approximately $3.5 million was paid in the fourth quarter of fiscal
	year 2016, with remaining amounts to be paid over the succeeding four years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	On December
	15, 2015, DeVry Brasil completed the acquisition of Grupo Ibmec. Grupo Ibmec is headquartered in S&atilde;o Paulo and operates
	campuses located in Rio de Janeiro, Brasilia and Belo Horizonte, and operates under the name Metrocamp in Campinas. A nationally
	recognized educational institution, Grupo Ibmec has been widely-known for its academic excellence for more than 40 years and currently
	serves nearly 15,000 undergraduate and graduate students onsite and online throughout Brazil. This acquisition continues the process
	of expanding DeVry Group&rsquo;s presence in Brazil. Under the terms of the agreement, DeVry Brasil agreed to pay approximately
	$191.0 million in cash, in exchange for the stock of Grupo Ibmec. The majority of payments were made in the second quarter of fiscal
	year 2016, with payments of approximately $10.5 million required over the succeeding six years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 91; VALUE: 3 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	91
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	During
	the first quarter of fiscal year 2016, the noncontrolling interest owners of DeVry Brasil exercised their option to put a portion
	of their DeVry Brasil stock to DeVry Group. Based on the formula established for the value of this put option, DeVry Group paid
	$3.1 million for an additional 1.6% ownership interest in DeVry Brasil. The members of the noncontrolling interest group maintain
	a 2.1% ownership interest in DeVry Brasil. Since July 1, 2015, DeVry Group has the right to exercise a call option and purchase
	any remaining DeVry Brasil stock from the noncontrolling interest group. Likewise, this group has the right to exercise a put option
	and sell its remaining ownership interest in DeVry Brasil to DeVry Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Cash Used in
	Financing Activities
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	DeVry
	Group&rsquo;s consolidated cash balances of $308.2 million at June 30, 2016, included approximately $95.3 million of cash attributable
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</FONT>
	to DeVry Group&rsquo;s international operations. It is DeVry Group&rsquo;s intention to indefinitely reinvest this cash
	and subsequent earnings and cash flow to improve and expand facilities and operations of its international schools and pursue future
	business opportunities outside the U.S. Therefore, cash held by international operations will not be available for domestic general
	corporate purposes. Management does not believe that this policy will adversely affect DeVry Group&rsquo;s overall liquidity. Should
	it be necessary to repatriate the international cash balances to the U.S., the repatriated cash would be subject to taxation at
	U.S. tax rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Historically,
	DeVry Group has produced positive domestic cash flows from operating activities sufficient to fund the delivery of its domestic
	educational programs and services as well as to fund capital investment and other activities including share repurchases and dividend
	payments. In addition, DeVry Group maintains a $400 million revolving line of credit which can be expanded to $550 million subject
	to bank approval. For fiscal year 2016, cash flows from domestic operating activities were approximately $168.3 million which when
	added to DeVry Group&rsquo;s beginning of the year domestic cash balances, was sufficient to fund $38.5 million of domestic capital
	investment, repurchase $32.6 million in common stock and pay dividends of $23.0 million in addition to funding other investment
	and financing activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Management
	believes that current balances of unrestricted cash, cash generated from operations and the revolving credit facility will be sufficient
	to fund both DeVry Group&rsquo;s current domestic and international operations and growth plans, and current share repurchase program,
	for the foreseeable future unless future significant investment opportunities should arise.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Revolving Credit
	Facility
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group
	entered into a revolving credit facility on March 31, 2015 which expires on March 31, 2020. The Credit Agreement provides for a
	multi-currency revolving credit facility in the amount of $400 million (the &ldquo;Aggregate Commitment&rdquo;) with availability
	in currencies other than U.S. dollars of up to $200 million. Up to $50 million of the Aggregate Commitment is available for letters
	of credit. Subject to certain conditions set forth in the Credit Agreement, the Aggregate Commitment may be increased up to $550
	million. DeVry Group may select interest rates for borrowings under the Credit Agreement equal to LIBOR or a LIBOR-equivalent rate
	for Eurocurrency Rate Loans or a base rate, plus an applicable rate based on DeVry Group&rsquo;s consolidated leverage ratio, as
	defined in the Credit Agreement. The applicable rate ranges from 2% to 3% for Eurocurrency Rate Loans and from 1% to 2% for Base
	Rate Loans. There are no required principal payments under this revolving credit agreement and all borrowings and letters of credit
	mature on March 31, 2020. As a result of the agreement extending beyond one year, any borrowings would be classified as long-term
	with the exception of amounts expected to be repaid in the 12 months subsequent to the balance sheet date. DeVry Group letters
	of credit outstanding under this agreement were $0.1 million as of each of June 30, 2016 and 2015. As of June 30, 2016, DeVry Group
	is charged an annual fee equal to 2.0% of the undrawn face amount of the outstanding letters of credit under the agreement, payable
	quarterly. The agreement also requires payment of a commitment fee equal to 0.35% of the undrawn portion of the credit facility
	as of June 30, 2016. The interest rate, letter of credit fees and commitment fees are adjustable quarterly, based upon DeVry Group&rsquo;s
	achievement of certain financial ratios.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	As
	of June 30, 2016, there were no borrowings under this agreement; however, on July 1, 2016, DeVry Group borrowed $175 million under
	its revolving credit facility to fund the acquisition of Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (&ldquo;ACAMS&rdquo;)
	(see &ldquo;Note 17: Subsequent Event&rdquo; to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Part II, Item 8 of this Form 10-K).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 92; VALUE: 3 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	92
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The revolving
	credit agreement contains covenants that, among other things, require maintenance of certain financial ratios, as defined in the
	agreement. Maintenance of these financial ratios could place restrictions on DeVry Group&rsquo;s ability to pay dividends. These
	financial ratios include a consolidated fixed charge coverage ratio, a consolidated leverage ratio and a U.S. Department of Education
	financial responsibility ratio based upon a composite score of an equity ratio, a primary reserve ratio and a net income ratio.
	Failure to maintain any of these ratios or to comply with other covenants contained in the agreement will constitute an event of
	default and could result in termination of the agreement and require payment of all outstanding borrowings and replacement of outstanding
	letters of credit. DeVry Group was in compliance with the debt covenants as of June 30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 90%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.3IN">

	DeVry Education Group Inc.
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Other Contractual
	Arrangements
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	DeVry
	Group&rsquo;s long-term contractual obligations consist of its $400 million revolving line of credit (discussed above), operating
	leases on facilities and equipment and agreements for various services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	In
	addition, DeVry Group has recorded liabilities for deferred purchase price agreements with sellers related to the acquisitions
	of Facid, FMF, Faci, Damasio, Grupo Ibmec and Facimp (see &ldquo;Note 8: Business Combinations&rdquo; to the Consolidated Financial
	Statements in Part II, Item 8 of this Form 10-K for a discussion of the FMF, Faci, Damasio, Grupo Ibmec and Facimp acquisitions).
	This financing is in the form of holdbacks of a portion of the purchase price of these acquisitions or installment payments. Payments
	are made under these agreements based on payment schedules or the resolution of any pre-acquisition contingencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	DeVry
	Group is not a party to any off-balance sheet financing or contingent payment arrangements, nor are there any unconsolidated subsidiaries.
	DeVry Group has not extended any loans to any officer, director or other affiliated person. DeVry Group has not entered into any
	synthetic leases, and there are no residual purchase or value commitments related to any facility lease. DeVry Group did not enter
	into any derivatives, swaps, futures contracts, calls, hedges or non-exchange traded contracts during fiscal year 2016. DeVry Group
	had no open derivative positions at June 30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	93
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	ITEM&nbsp;7A&nbsp;&ndash; QUANTITATIVE
	AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET
</U>
</B>
<U>
<B>
<A NAME="V446933_10K_HTM_A_011">
</A>
	RISK
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group is not
	dependent upon the price levels, nor affected by fluctuations in pricing, of any particular commodity or group of commodities.
	However, more than 50% of DeVry Group&rsquo;s costs are in the form of wages and benefits. Changes in employment market conditions
	or escalations in employee benefit costs could cause DeVry Group to experience cost increases at levels beyond what it has historically
	experienced.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The financial position
	and results of operations of DMI&rsquo;s St. Maarten, St. Kitts and Dominica operations are measured using the U.S.&nbsp;dollar
	as the functional currency. Substantially all of these financial transactions are denominated in the U.S.&nbsp;dollar.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The financial position
	and results of operations of DeVry Group&rsquo;s investment in DeVry Brasil are measured using the Brazilian Real as the functional
	currency. DeVry Brasil has not entered into any material long-term contracts to purchase or sell goods and services, other than
	the lease agreements on teaching facilities and contingencies relating to prior acquisitions. Currently, DeVry Group does not have
	any foreign exchange contracts or derivative financial instruments designed to mitigate changes in the value of the Brazilian Real.
	Brazilian-based assets constitute approximately 27.8% of DeVry Group&rsquo;s overall assets, and its Brazilian liabilities constitute
	approximately 16.4% of overall liabilities. The Brazilian Real has been volatile in relation to the U.S. dollar over the past 12
	months, declining as much as 22% by December 2015, and recovering most of that loss by the end of fiscal year 2016. DeVry Group
	made investments in Brazil during the fiscal year, the largest of which was the purchase of Grupo Ibmec in December 2015 at one
	of the lowest exchange rates experienced during the year. Thus, although the value of the Brazilian Real was little changed in
	relation to the U.S. dollar at June 30, 2016, compared to the prior year, Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss declined by $34.6
	million because of a translation adjustment gain experienced on the Grupo Ibmec investment. Based upon the current value of the
	net assets in DeVry Brasil&rsquo;s operations, a change of $0.01 in the value of the Brazilian Real relative to the U.S.&nbsp;dollar
	results in a translation adjustment to Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss of approximately $15.8 million. The volatility in value
	of the Brazilian Real has also resulted in lower than expected U.S. translated revenue and operating income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The interest rate
	on DeVry Group&rsquo;s revolving credit facility is based upon LIBOR or a LIBOR-equivalent rate for Eurocurrency Rate Loans or
	a base rate for periods typically ranging from one to three months. Based upon borrowings of $50 million, a 100 basis point increase
	in short-term interest rates would result in approximately $0.5&nbsp;million of additional annual interest expense. At June 30,
	2016, DeVry Group had no outstanding borrowings under this facility.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group&rsquo;s
	customers are principally individual students enrolled in its various educational programs. Accordingly, concentration of accounts
	receivable credit risk is small relative to total revenue and accounts receivable. However, as discussed in &ldquo;Item 7 &ndash;
	Management&rsquo;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&rdquo; in subsection &ldquo;Liquidity
	and Capital Resources&rdquo; of this Form 10-K, the DeVry Brasil FIES accounts receivable balance has increased to $67.1 million
	as of June 30, 2016. The FIES funding for calendar year 2015, accounts for $29.9 million of the total outstanding FIES balance.
	In January 2016, DeVry Brasil entered into a repayment agreement with the Brazilian government pursuant to which these 2015 funds
	will paid in annual installments over three years. The first annual installment of $7.2 million was received by DeVry Brasil on
	July 1, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group&rsquo;s
	cash is held in accounts at various large, financially secure depository institutions. Although the amount on deposit at a given
	institution typically will exceed amounts subject to guarantee, DeVry Group has not experienced any deposit losses to date, nor
	does management expect to incur such losses in the future.
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
<A NAME="V446933_10K_HTM_A_012">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;8&nbsp;&ndash; FINANCIAL
	STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The following financial

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
<A NAME="V446933_10K_HTM_A_014">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;9A&nbsp;&ndash; CONTROLS
	AND PROCEDURES
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Principal Executive and Principal
	Financial Officer Certificates
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The required compliance certificates
	signed by the DeVry Group&rsquo;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer are included as Exhibits&nbsp;31 and 32 of
	this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Disclosure
	controls and procedures are designed to help ensure that all the information required to be disclosed in DeVry Group&rsquo;s reports
	filed under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &ldquo;Exchange Act&rdquo;), is recorded, processed, summarized and reported
	within the time periods specified by the applicable rules and forms.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group&rsquo;s
	Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have concluded, based on their evaluation as of the end of the period covered
	by this report, that DeVry Group&rsquo;s disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) of the Exchange Act)
	are effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed in the reports that DeVry Group files or submits under the Exchange
	Act is (i) recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission&rsquo;s
	rules and forms, and (ii) is accumulated and communicated to DeVry Group&rsquo;s management, including its Chief Executive Officer
	and Chief Financial Officer, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Management&rsquo;s
	Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The management
	of DeVry Group is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as defined by
	Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f) of the Exchange Act. Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not
	prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk
	that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures
	may deteriorate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	As of June&nbsp;30,
	2016, DeVry Group&rsquo;s management has assessed the effectiveness of its internal control over financial reporting, using the
	criteria specified by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission&rsquo;s 2013 report Internal Control&nbsp;&mdash;
	Integrated Framework. Based upon this assessment, DeVry Group concluded that as of June&nbsp;30, 2016, its internal control over
	financial reporting was effective based upon these criteria.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	The effectiveness
	of DeVry Group&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 has been audited by PricewaterhouseCoopers
	LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm, as stated in their report which appears herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<U>
	Changes in Internal
	Control Over Financial Reporting
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	There were
	no changes in internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016 that materially
	affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, DeVry Group&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.15IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	of these consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	$
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1,582,087
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_STOCKHOLDERS_EQUITY>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	The accompanying notes are an integral part
	of these consolidated financial statements.
</P>

<B>

<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;1:&nbsp;NATURE OF OPERATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Education Group
	Inc. (&ldquo;DeVry Group&rdquo;) is a global provider of educational services and one of the largest publicly-held educational
	organizations in the world. DeVry Group&rsquo;s wholly owned subsidiaries include:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 95%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.15IN">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 59%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine (&ldquo;AUC&rdquo;)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 41%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	B Carrington College (&ldquo;Carrington&rdquo;)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Ross University School of Medicine (&ldquo;RUSM&rdquo;)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	R Becker Professional Education (&ldquo;Becker&rdquo;)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine (&ldquo;RUSVM&rdquo;)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	DeVry University
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Chamberlain College of Nursing (&ldquo;Chamberlain&rdquo;)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	In addition, DeVry
	Group maintains a 97.9% ownership interest in DeVry Brasil; a Brazilian postsecondary education organization. These institutions
	offer degree and non-degree programs in business, healthcare and technology and serve students in postsecondary education as well
	as accounting, finance and legal professionals.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	AUC operates a campus
	in the Caribbean country of St. Maarten. Students complete their basic science curriculum in a modern, fully equipped campus in
	the Caribbean and complete their clinical education in the U.S., Canadian and United Kingdom&nbsp;teaching hospitals and veterinary
	schools under affiliation with AUC.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	RUSM operates a campus
	in the Caribbean country of Dominica. RUSM students complete their basic science curriculum in a modern, fully equipped campus
	in the Caribbean and complete their clinical education in the U.S. and Canadian&nbsp;teaching hospitals under affiliation with
	RUSM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	RUSVM operates a campus
	in the Caribbean country of St. Kitts. RUSVM students complete their basic science curriculum in a modern, fully equipped campus
	in the Caribbean and complete their clinical education in the U.S.&nbsp;and international veterinary schools under affiliation
	with RUSVM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Chamberlain offers
	pre-licensure associate and bachelor&rsquo;s degree programs in nursing at 20 campus locations and post-licensure bachelor&rsquo;s,
	master&rsquo;s and doctorate degree programs in nursing through its online platform. Non-clinical coursework is offered both on
	campus and online.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Carrington operates
	21 academic sites in 8 western states. Carrington offers degree and diploma programs primarily in health care, dental and veterinary
	career fields.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Becker prepares candidates
	for the Certified Public Accountant (&ldquo;CPA&rdquo;), Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (&ldquo;ACCA&rdquo;) and
	Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (&ldquo;CIMA&rdquo;) professional certification examinations, and offers continuing
	professional education programs and seminars in accounting and finance. These classes are taught in nearly 300 locations, including
	sites in 55 foreign countries and some DeVry University teaching sites. Becker&rsquo;s physicians review offers comprehensive review
	programs for physicians preparing for the United States Medical Licensing Examination (&ldquo;USMLE&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Brasil is based
	in the city of Fortaleza, State of Cear&aacute;, in the Northeast region of Brazil and is currently comprised of 13 institutions:
	Faculdades Nordeste (&ldquo;Fanor&rdquo;), Faculdade Ruy Barbosa (&ldquo;Ruy Barbosa&rdquo;) Faculdade &Aacute;REA1 (&ldquo;&Aacute;REA1&rdquo;),
	Faculdade Boa Viagem (&ldquo;FBV&rdquo;), Centro Universit&aacute;rio Vale do Ipojuca (&ldquo;UniFavip&rdquo;), Faculdade Diferencial
	Integral (&ldquo;Facid&rdquo;), Faculdade DeVry S&atilde;o Luis (&ldquo;DeVry Sao Luis&rdquo;), Faculdade DeVry Joao Pessoa (&ldquo;DeVry
	Joao Pessoa&rdquo;), Faculdade Martha Falc&atilde;o (&ldquo;FMF&rdquo;), Faculdade Ideal (&ldquo;Faci&rdquo;), Dam&aacute;sio Educacional
	(&ldquo;Damasio&rdquo;), Grupo Ibmec Educacional S.A. (&ldquo;Grupo Ibmec&rdquo;) and Faculdade de Imperatriz (&ldquo;Facimp&rdquo;).
	These schools operate 22 academic sites located in 12 States in Northeast, North and Southeast Brazil. DeVry Brasil also operates
	approximately 220 distance learning centers throughout Brazil under Damasio&rsquo;s franchise agreements. DeVry Brasil&rsquo;s
	institutions offer undergraduate and graduate programs mainly focused in business, management, medical, healthcare, law and engineering.
	In addition, Damasio offers legal bar exam review courses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry University is
	one of the largest regionally accredited higher education systems in North America, offering associate, bachelor&rsquo;s and master&rsquo;s
	degree programs in technology, healthcare technology, business and management. At June&nbsp;30, 2016, DeVry University programs
	were offered at 60 locations in the U.S. and through DeVry University&rsquo;s online platform.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 101; VALUE: 3 -->

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:&nbsp;DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	In December 2013,
	the assets of DeVry Group&rsquo;s Advanced Academics Inc. (&ldquo;AAI&rdquo;) subsidiary, which had previously been disclosed as
	&ldquo;held for sale&rdquo; were divested. These assets were sold for $2.0 million, which approximated the recorded net book value
	of the assets on the date of sale. The operating results of AAI are separately disclosed in the Consolidated Statements of Income
	(Loss) as &ldquo;Discontinued Operations &ndash; Income (Loss) from Operations of Divested Component.&rdquo; The following is a
	summary of operating results of the discontinued operations for the years ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 (in thousands). The reported
	Income from Operations of Divested Component in fiscal year 2015 is comprised of $1.0 million in pre-tax income from the net settlement
	of service agreements and an adjustment of $5.0 million related to correction of an error to properly record the income tax benefit
	of the impairment charge taken in the first quarter of fiscal year 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;3:&nbsp;SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT
	ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Principles
	of Consolidation
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 11PT">
	The Consolidated Financial
	Statements include the accounts of DeVry Group and its wholly-owned and majority-owned domestic and foreign subsidiaries. All intercompany
	balances and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation. Where our ownership interest is less than 100 percent, the noncontrolling
	ownership interests are reported on our Consolidated Balance Sheets. The noncontrolling ownership interest in our earnings is classified
	as &ldquo;Net Income Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest&rdquo; in our Consolidated Statements of Income (Loss). Unless indicated,
	or the context requires otherwise, references to years refer to DeVry Group&rsquo;s fiscal years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Cash and
	Cash Equivalents
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 11PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents
	can include time deposits, high-grade commercial paper, money market funds and bankers acceptances with original maturities of
	three months or less. Short-term investment objectives are to minimize risk and maintain liquidity. These investments are stated
	at cost (which approximates fair value) because of their short duration or liquid nature. DeVry Group places its cash and temporary
	cash investments with high credit quality institutions. Cash and cash equivalent balances in U.S. bank accounts are generally in
	excess of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (&ldquo;FDIC&rdquo;) insurance limit. Cash and cash equivalent balances in
	Brazilian bank accounts are generally in excess of the deposit insurance limits for Brazilian banks. DeVry Group has not experienced
	any losses on its cash and cash equivalents.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 11PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 11PT">
	Management periodically
	evaluates the creditworthiness of the security issuers and financial institutions with which it invests and maintains deposit accounts.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Marketable
	Securities and Investments
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	DeVry Group owns investments
	in marketable securities that have been designated as &ldquo;available-for-sale&rdquo; in accordance with authoritative guidance.
	Available-for-sale securities are carried at fair value with the unrealized gains and losses reported in the Consolidated Balance
	Sheets as a component of Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	Marketable securities
	and investments consist of investments in mutual funds which are classified as available-for-sale securities. The following is
	a summary of our available-for-sale marketable securities at June 30, 2016 (in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.15IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 102; VALUE: 3 -->
